item.title: On looking out of the plane window
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
In the space of just over a hundred years, we’ve gone from the world’s first commercial flight (with just one paying passenger on a 40-kilometre route in Florida which took 23 minutes) to the dawn of space tourism. On average, eight million people fly somewhere every day. Today, the longest non-stop flight in the world […]

The post On looking out of the plane window appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: A green resolution for 2016
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
Lose weight, get fit, quit smoking, travel more: these are our most commonly made (and broken) resolutions at the beginning of each new year. What doesn’t make it onto the usual list but should be there is: spend more time in nature. Currently more than half of the world’s population lives in urban areas and […]

The post A green resolution for 2016 appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: On ditching the travel bucket list
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
In the 2007 film The Bucket List, two terminally ill characters played by Jack Nicholson and Morgan Freeman meet in a cancer ward, which they escape to do a road trip to tick off their wish list of things to do, including seeing the Taj Mahal and skydiving, before they die. Since then the term […]

The post On ditching the travel bucket list appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: Shoot less, remember more
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
Going trigger happy on holidays and shooting hundreds of photos may not be the best way of remembering those special moments you experience – doing a beautiful hike, taking in an idyllic sunset on the beach or standing in front of a famous view. In a recent study, a group of students went to an art […]

The post Shoot less, remember more appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: Why you should spend money on travel rather than things
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
Want to be happier? It’s simple: buy less material things and spend more money on experiences, like travel. This route to contentment is backed up by science: over the past decade psychologists have done extensive research and studies into why experiences make us happier than things. Most of us have finite amounts of wealth and […]

The post Why you should spend money on travel rather than things appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.
